text:
Generating a tagdiff report with CVS 1.11.9 reports nothing in the "New Files" 
section. Running the same task with CVS 1.11 shows the new files.

It appears that the output from the cvs rdiff command has changed slightly for 
new files...

CVS 1.11
File apps/websphere/lib/something.jar is new; current revision 1.2
CVS 1.11.9
File apps/websphere/lib/something.jar is new; cvstag_2003_11_03_2 revision 1.2

The CvsTagDiff.java has the old output hardcoded into it on line 116.
If this line is altered as follows it will work with old and new versions of 
cvs.

-    static final String FILE_IS_NEW = " is new; current revision ";
+    static final String FILE_IS_NEW = " is new; ";
creator: riznob@hotmail.com

text:
Created attachment 8927
The proposed patch to CvsTagDiff.java
creator: riznob@hotmail.com
riznob@hotmail.com
text:
It seems that there is more to this issue than I had originally thought. The 
tag diff needs to take into account the change in output from cvs in the 
parseRDiff method also. Also, the output has changed for removed files as well. 
I am working on a patch that will address all of these things.

Removed files are not an issue because their version is not reported. I have 
addressed the issue with the parseRDiff method in the patch that follows.
creator: riznob@hotmail.com
riznob@hotmail.com
text:
Created attachment 8946
Proposed patch to resolve all issues related to this bug

creator: antoine@apache.org
text:
Created attachment 8951
patch tested against 2 different version

I have just attached a patch which I have tested against CVS 1.11.5-FreeBSD and
CVS 1.12.2.
I noticed that the format of the output of the cvs rdiff is dependent upon the
CVS server and not upon the client (at least in this case).
I installed CVS 1.12.2 on my PC.
I used cvs.apache.org to check backward compatibility.
creator: antoine@apache.org

text:
Problem fixed.
Thanks for reporting the bug and chiming in.
creator: antoine@apache.org
